isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Connecting Rods, Pistons and Piston Rings - Installation - New Style Connecting Rod

item.para: DO NOT use any air powered tools when installing and tightening connecting rod bolts. This can cause seizure of connecting rod bolts.
When installing the connecting rod and piston assembly into the cylinder bore BE SURE TO:
Install the connecting rod and piston assemble into the cylinder bore from which it was removed.

Keep the fractured mating surfaces clean and free of lint and debris. Do not allow the mating surfaces to rest on any surface. Do not bump the mating surfaces or drop the connecting rod or cap. This could cause chipping and wear on the mating surface, resulting in improper mating during installation and possible engine damage.

If the rod cap is reversed when assembled to the connecting rod or a rod cap is NOT installed on its original matching connecting rod, the fractured mating surfaces will be ruined. This may cause the rod cap to come loose and cause engine damage. The entire connecting rod must be replaced.

note.para: Install the piston and connecting rod assemblies after the piston cooling jets and crankshaft have been installed.

step1.para: Turn crankshaft so the appropriate crankpin is at the bottom of its stroke.
Make sure the connecting rod bearing shells are properly installed in the bearing cap and the connecting rod.

Coat piston and piston rings with clean engine oil. Coat cylinder walls, crankshaft journals, and piston cope with clean engine oil. (The cope is a special tool designed to hold the piston rings in place during installation.)

figure.caption: Correct Orientation of a Properly Installed Piston

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, the arrow located on top of the piston must face the camshaft side of the crankcase and the large chamfer on the connecting rod must be positioned next to the crankshaft fillet.

figure.caption: Installing the Piston and Connecting Rod Into the Cylinder Bore

step1.para: Place the piston with rings and connecting rod installed, into the cope.
Install bearing shells into connecting rod and cap. Coat bearing shell in connecting rod with clean engine oil.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, when installing connecting rod and piston into cylinder bore, be careful not to damage the piston cooling tube.

step1.para: Carefully insert connecting rod and piston into cylinder bore.

figure.caption: Seating the Piston in the Cylinder Bore

step1.para: Once piston and connecting rod have been inserted into the cylinder bore, use the handle of a hammer to tap piston into crankcase bore. Guide connecting rod into place over crankshaft journal.

note.para: Be sure each connecting rod is matched with the original bearing cap on the same crankpin from which they were removed.

step1.para: Coat the bearing shell and connecting rod surfaces with clean engine oil. Install the bearing cap on the connecting rod.
Install and tighten the connecting rod mounting nuts or bolts to the special torque value.
Repeat installation procedure for remaining connecting rod and piston assemblies.
Check connecting rod side clearance with feeler gauge. Refer to "REMOVAL" in this section for the correct procedure.
